intro: Narcissus marvieri, commonly known as the Marvier's daffodil, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to the Iberian Peninsula and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or white. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces a single stem with a cluster of blooms. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or borders. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
